articles.description: More than 940,000 mail-in ballots have been requested in Georgia for the January 5 runoff election that will decide which party controls the Senate, Gabriel Sterling, the state's voting systems implementation manager, said Monday.

articles.title: Why one Biden pick may have a harder time getting confirmed
articles.description: CNN's Jeff Zeleny reports on President-elect Joe Biden's diverse economic team with four women in top roles.

articles.author: Analysis by Chris Cillizza, CNN Editor-at-large
articles.title: This conservative outlet just crushed Donald Trump's election claims
articles.description: When you think of conservatism in America, you think of the National Review. Founded in the mid-1950s by William F. Buckley Jr., the publication has been a bulwark of conservative thought for almost the entirety of one Donald J. Trump's life.
articles.content:
THE POINT -- NOW ON YOUTUBE! 
In each episode of his weekly YouTube show, Chris Cillizza will delve a little deeper into the surreal world of politics. Click to subscribe!

articles.title: Justice Department releases Trump's pardon of Flynn and asks court for dismissal
articles.description: The Justice Department on Monday released a copy of President Donald Trump's pardon of former national security adviser Michael Flynn and formally asked a federal court to dismiss the case against him.

articles.title: READ: Trump's pardon of Michael Flynn

articles.author: Samira Said and Marshall Cohen, CNN
articles.title: Wisconsin finalizes Biden's victory after partial recount
articles.description: The Wisconsin Elections Commission finalized the state's presidential results on Monday, affirming President-elect Joe Biden's victory after a recount in Wisconsin's two most populous counties.

articles.title: Celebrity Chef David Chang won $1 million. He's giving it all to restaurants workers

articles.author: Ryan Browne, CNN
articles.title: Navy to de-commission and scrap warship USS Bonhomme Richard after major fire
articles.description: The US Navy has decided to de-commission and scrap the USS Bonhomme Richard after a damage assessment found that restoring the ship would cost billions of dollars.

articles.author: Konstantin Toropin and Leah Asmelash, CNN
articles.title: A nurse is suspended after her TikTok bragging about breaking Covid-19 rules goes viral
articles.description: While many health care workers have used social media to show Americans the harsh effects of the Covid-19 pandemic, one Oregon nurse is in trouble for doing the opposite.

articles.author: Hanna Ziady, CNN Business
articles.title: Topshop owner Arcadia files for bankruptcy
articles.description: UK retailer Arcadia is seeking protection from creditors as it scrambles to save 13,000 jobs and brands such as Topshop after clothing sales collapsed during the pandemic.

articles.title: GOP official warns Trump that he's being misled
articles.description: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp and Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who are both Republicans, rebuffed President Donald Trump's calls to overturn the state's election results more than a week after they certified Joe Biden as the winner.

articles.author: Scottie Andrew, CNN
articles.title: 11 unprovoked attacks in one month have rocked a Massachusetts city
articles.description: As of last week, there have been 11 unprovoked assaults recorded in the city, police said. The victims were all attacked with a blunt object by an unknown assailant after dark.

articles.title: Key questions about the assassination of Iran's top nuclear scientist
articles.description: Iran's top nuclear scientist was killed Friday in the outskirts of Tehran, once again setting the Middle East on edge and threatening to bring further turmoil to the region.

articles.author: Kara Scannell
articles.title: Judge postpones Rudy Giuliani associates' trial because of backlog from Covid-19
articles.description: A federal judge postponed the trial for Rudy Giuliani associates Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman citing the backlog of criminal trials as courts grapple with the coronavirus pandemic.
